alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 1:20PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Weld and northeastern Larimer Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 119 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Carr, or 21 miles north of Fort Collins, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail and brief heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wellington, Nunn, and Carr. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized street flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
